civil_war_clocks.description: Track the progression of the civil war between Imperials and Stormcloaks

imperial_military_dominance.name: Imperial Military Dominance
imperial_military_dominance.description: Imperial Legion's progress toward winning the civil war through military victories
imperial_military_dominance.completion_effect: Imperial Legion wins the civil war decisively
advancement_triggers: Imperial victory in major battle (+1 to +2)

stormcloak_rebellion_momentum.name: Stormcloak Rebellion Momentum
stormcloak_rebellion_momentum.description: Stormcloak forces' progress toward independence and military victory
stormcloak_rebellion_momentum.completion_effect: Stormcloaks win the civil war and Skyrim gains independence
advancement_triggers: Stormcloak victory in major battle (+1 to +2)

battle_of_whiterun_countdown.name: Battle of Whiterun Countdown
battle_of_whiterun_countdown.description: Tension builds as both sides prepare for the pivotal Battle of Whiterun
battle_of_whiterun_countdown.completion_effect: Battle of Whiterun occurs - Whiterun must choose a side or fall
advancement_triggers: Player delays choosing sides (+1 per session)
story_hooks: At 4/8: Messengers from both sides pressure Balgruuf
At 8/8: Battle begins - party must participate or witness consequences
battle_of_whiterun_countdown.gm_notes: This clock creates urgency. The Battle of Whiterun is a major turning point that forces Balgruuf and potentially the party to choose sides.

thalmor_civil_war_manipulation.name: Thalmor Civil War Manipulation
thalmor_civil_war_manipulation.description: Thalmor agents work to prolong the civil war and keep both sides weak
thalmor_civil_war_manipulation.completion_effect: Thalmor successfully prevent decisive victory, keeping Skyrim divided and weak
advancement_triggers: Intelligence given to weaker side to balance war (+2)
Diplomatic Immunity quest not completed (+1 per Act)
setback_triggers: Party shares Thalmor documents from embassy (-3)
thalmor_civil_war_manipulation.secret_objective: Neither side should win quickly. The goal is prolonged conflict.

civilian_war_weariness.name: Civilian War Weariness
civilian_war_weariness.description: The toll of civil war on Skyrim's common people
civilian_war_weariness.completion_effect: Mass civilian unrest, refugees flood major cities, economy collapses
story_hooks: At 4/8: Refugees begin appearing in cities
At 6/8: Food prices skyrocket, black markets flourish
At 8/8: Riots and complete breakdown of order

battle_of_whiterun_stages.name: Battle of Whiterun Stages
battle_of_whiterun_stages.description: Tracks progression through the 5-stage Battle of Whiterun structure
battle_of_whiterun_stages.completion_effect: Battle of Whiterun concluded; faction gains control of Whiterun Hold

segments.label: Stage 1: First line resolved (Dragonsreach breach or outer barricades)

advancement_triggers: Party completes a battle stage (+1 per stage)
Faction commander survives to lead next stage (+0, required to advance normally)
battle_of_whiterun_stages.gm_notes: Advance 1 segment per completed stage. Clock fills when all 5 stages are done.

hadvar_ralof_rivalry.name: Hadvar/Ralof Rivalry
hadvar_ralof_rivalry.description: Tracks the escalating personal conflict between Hadvar and Ralof across the Battle of Whiterun
hadvar_ralof_rivalry.completion_effect: Rivalry reaches a breaking point; forces a definitive confrontation with major canon consequences

escalation_hooks.event: First clash: Hadvar and Ralof cross paths in the chaos; no resolution yet.
Direct confrontation at the Gildergreen; one side yields or the other.
Aftermath wounds: surviving party carries scars from the confrontation.
Word spreads: other soldiers take sides; morale effects ripple through both armies.
Personal vendetta: whichever of Hadvar/Ralof survived becomes obsessed with the outcome.
Resolution forced: final confrontation or genuine reconciliation; Dragonbreak precheck triggered.

advancement_triggers: Both survive the battle with unresolved tension (+1)
PC avoids resolving the confrontation in Stage 3/4 (+1)
setback_triggers: Ralof or Hadvar outcome: turned (-2, rivalry replaced by complex alliance)
PC brokered a ceasefire between them (-3)

battle_of_whiterun.description: The pivotal battle that will determine Whiterun's allegiance
battle_of_whiterun.importance: Critical - Forces neutral parties to choose sides
possible_outcomes: Stormcloak victory - Whiterun falls to Stormcloaks
Stalemate - Both sides weakened, Thalmor benefit

siege_of_solitude.description: Stormcloak assault on Imperial capital of Skyrim

gm_guidance.pacing: Advance civil war clocks every 2-3 sessions or after major story events
gm_guidance.player_impact: Player actions should significantly affect clock progression
gm_guidance.integration: Civil war events should intersect with main quest at key moments (Battle of Whiterun, Season Unending, The Fallen)
gm_guidance.tension: Keep both sides roughly balanced until party commits or Act III
